alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 09 at 3:00PM AKDT until April 09 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches with the highest amounts in East Anchorage, Eagle River and higher elevations. * WHERE...Anchorage. * WHEN...Until 10 PM AKDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Wind gusts up to 20 mph in west Anchorage may produce blowing and drifting snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A band of snow associated with an inverted surface trough has encompassed Anchorage for a good part of this afternoon and will continue at least for the next couple hours. There continues to still be uncertainty on when the snow may end this evening due to uncertainty stemming from the track of the surface low pressure in the vicinity of Prince William Sound.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
